reviews.text:
A place for you to meet Buddha.  
Lots of books for you to read and take home.  The main area was under renovation but still the ambience was great.
Very open, quiet and Calm place to pray & also has a library next to the office if you want to buy books about Buddhism & also has Sunday school teaching classes.

It was a great temple in the one of busy city in Kuala Lumpur situated main city but really very quite places....,

I like to visit every single time when I have no work I am free I ho for control my mind make fresher
Historical Buddhist establishment of Sri Lanka heritage. Meditation classes and retreats available
Old Buddhist temple with large bodhi trees. Good place to worship or simply enjoy the serene calm ambience

This ornate Chinese temple is dedicated to the Queen of Heaven, Thean Hou, protectorate of people who make their living from the sea. The temple borrows from Buddhist, Taoist and Confucian traditions. I believe the panoramic views of KL alone make the trip up the hill worthwhile. Whilst we were there we witnessed a fantastic electrical storm complete with some of the loudest claps of thunder I have ever heard.

People didn't seem to know where it was but we found a taxi driver who knew the way - TIP unlike other places its worth having your taxi/transport wait for you as the few taxis there were booked for return trips and the guard said you would either need to phone one or walk to the road. The temple was clean (including the toilets) and there were very few people there surprisingly. On the lower ground floor there are a couple of authentic shops worth visiting that sell a range of non tacky souvenirs.

It's a great place to visit in kl. The scenery is very good and it's free for the ticket. There will have some couple come here for marriage registration, and here actually is quite special with the way of get the request of sign from the god 求签. It's really simple but somehow quite true. And no worry as the paper of sign 解签also given in English.

Beautiful temple. Really like the decorations with many lanterns and the culture. Try to pick up lucky number and fortune teller of this number. Have some very nice spots for photos. Also show respect if you come here.

One of the most beautiful Chinese temples in Kuala Lumpur. A must visit for tourists. It's a bit further inside from the main road, so no easy nearby public transport to get here. There is quite a lot of parking space for drivers. There are 4 or 5 main areas in the temple to visit. When one arrives, there is the courtyard and garden outside. The garden has statues of the animals of the zodiac and other deities. Then head up to the main temple on Level 2. A very good place for photos. Just be mindful not to intrude people who come to pray. In the main temple, visit the 3 main deities. And then head up to the upper floor for a better view of the entire temple. Head also to the back of the temple for the statue garden and read the stories of each of the persons portrayed. Then head down to the lower ground for the canteen, drinks, food and souvenir shops. Best time to come will be early morning or later part of the evening. Afternoons here are really hot. A must visit.

Pretty place that is serene. A lot of devotees come here to pay respect to Tian Hou, goddess of the sea, for good luck. Can feel the heritage and culture as you step in the place. Should visit when you are in Kl if you could afford the time.

How I wish I could give more than just 5 stars. The service is on point! Food was so good. Especially the sweet stuff filled in a cup called Swat.  

Brought my friend here to try Indian food for the first time and she loved it!(she's someone who is very particular about food) so you can guess how nice this is. Oh I'm BTW I'm Chinese and I am definitely coming back here again.

It's okay .. good for  vegetarian ppl as it's a pure veg restaurant.. the food is good and spicy but the north Indian dishes don't have the desired taste. So it's better to order the south Indian cuisine.
1 of my favorite food heaven. Use to hang wt friends.. 1 love masala ;-p

Pathetic food taste , the staff in chat masala is very rude and made faces .

If we call them , they ignore and make faces .

Very very bad experience.
I recommend don't go to this place
Proper India style restaurant. Good food and cheap. All vegetarian!

This is a strip down version of the iconic Saravana Bhavan in India. It's strictly for those who miss good south Indian food and haven't been to Chennai/India in a long time - Beggars can't be Choosers!! For those traveling and can't do without vegetarian food, it's a good choice and you won't be disappointed. Until now the only good south Indian food option I have found in Malaysia is at "HOME" :-)
Definitely great experience eating here. Brand has a premium, so not the cheapest place around.. If you want quality, eat here

A tantalizing treat guaranteed to make any food lover drool. Made moments before serving, at least that's what it seemed. Got a pretty good portion size for a relatively reasonable price. Would definitely recommend stopping by at least once.
The food is always good, the place is clean and the staff are helpful
Not bad - dosas aren’t great but most everything else is. Chilli Govi is recommended if you like spicy.

Very Bad service, went there for a take away on 2nd March 2019, the restaurant was not even crowded when we visited there. Apart from making us wait, me and my friend were humiliated by the lady (who was packing food, with the short hair and bossy behavior) and was passing comments to the other customer, ignored us for almost 25 minutes.  She was showing her superiority in body language and actions. Hopefully someone will educate her on the role she plays in the restaurant. I have seen her  in the restaurant for almost a decade, but in the cash counter, may be she was assigned to pack food, for which she was not happy. If the staff is not in a state to do a particular task, she should not be doing that. Even the restaurant boss should treat the customers in a proper way, but we felt embarrassed and couldn't come out of the thoughts happened to me there. For sure, I will never step into that restaurant.

A decent Indian food outlet serving Chetinad cuisine. Busy during lunchtime with banana leaf meal available. Service is good despite the heavy human traffic. Price wise is by choice of food wise. Banana leaf meal with huge portion of rice and vegetable dishes at the set price is considered reasonably.
Good tasty food, variety of choices. Reasonably priced and quick service. Hygiene and cleanliness of fod preparation need to give more attention.
Extreme delicious banana food with varieties of fried seafood

Nice chettinadu cuisine..regular indian meals..u can choose fish or chicken n they will fry for u immidiately..
Service are quite slow ..overall a good home feel food..✔3/5

Enjoy the Chef's Special Set Menu of six small courses. Diverse tastes in each dish and all beautifully plated. Service staff were friendly and accommodating. We really enjoyed the set menu and felt like it was the right amount - we weren't left hungry but didn't feel stuffed or sick either. Thank you for a lovely evening.

Taste is average, bordering good. The lamb in cumin was the winner. Soon hock is about the right size but on high side of pricing. Total damage for 6-people with the food you see below comes up to RM1177 incl taxes. Understandably it’s a hotel. Ambience is nice but service can be improved as we had to constantly pour our own tea.
Excellent service with great ambience. Great Ambience and Great Food too. Happy Rainy Day! ;)
Premium halal Chinese food. Nice ambience and food was good! Nice cosy room to host a small event. Up to 6 tables in a separated area
Excellent service with great ambience. Good food too.

Constructed in 1910 and built on the same site as the previous railway station.The outside architecture is attractive and looks more or less similar to some surrounding buildings in the same style. Remarkable fact is that as well Western as Eastern elements are used in the construction of this station.
Big capacity with 3 times 4 tracks with on each level 2 side tracks.
This station is an important transportation hub for all metro connections and for other railway transportation types.

I feel the services offered her are top class. Since l always use the train to travel, l would say that l always feel at ease every time l deal with the ticketing officers, the ticketing masters at the exit and entrance gates, the auxiliary policemen, all show courtesy and patience in dealing with the passengers.
Also the food court serves all kinds of food to whet your appetite.
Kudos KL Sentral, keep up the good work!
Some interesting architecture but most of the building was shut. We read you could see some old relics but we couldn't find them.
Great location where you can go everywhere by any transport you want ... Surrounded by a lot of places too... food court, banks, shopping centre..bcause it linked to NU sentral shopping centre too...
An old station but still operating.. KL Sentral is the better version of it..

The National Mosque is a part of a large complex where, in addition to the mosque, there is still important space for gardens, trees , water pools, roads and  covered walkways. The mosque has a very large capacity and can receive 15,000 people. It was built in 1965 on the foundations of an earlier church. She symbolizes Malaysia as an Islamic state. The minaret is 73 meters high. Wonderful whole and definitely worth a visit.

A stunning cool and comfortable mosque.  The ladies section upstairs for Juma was a little disappointing, almost an after thought.  And it's an area that seems to be shared with contractors! 

The lady that does Arabic calligraphy outside is amazing.  Perfect for a keepsake.

One of the beautiful landmark in Kuala Lumpur. This is Malaysia National Mosque. Located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur. Build on 1963 on 13 acres of land. The are few entrances to this mosque. It is normally full during the Friday prayers.

Beautiful mosque. It's called the national mosque but the locals call is Negara mosque. It's beautiful architecture, its. Mostly open space. Free to enter, remember to remove your shoes, take them with you so you can leave via another exit. Robes are provided for free. You can't enter the main prayer hall unless you want to pray (Muslims). Worth a visit.

Beautiful and HUGE mosque, however the fountains were all empty of water. Furthermore the wall clocks weren't working and some of the taps in the ablution area also seem to have been malfunctioning. But I was really amazed by the size of the mosque and the beautiful architecture it possessed. Also had praying and ablution areas for the ladies.

I have recently visited this place.... Most beautiful place to go.... A museum was also here which tells you about history of Muslim hero... History of Pakistan and also tells about the culture of Pakistan 🇵🇰.... The main beauty of Pakistan monument emerges out during night..... The lightning system make it most beautiful...... You can also take a look at city which is more beautiful at night.....

Amazing views. One of the good place to visit. 
Would prefer to avoid weekends as it can get very busy. 
Toilets aren’t so clean. However there are always cleaner try their best to clean but people!
If your are foreigner then please don’t buy ordinary ticket as there no where mention foreigner ticket price. 
I paid 250 PKR for 1 foreigner. Security guard  on the entrance  gate was very rude. Even though he knew I had foreigners with me. And he told me to not visit Pakistan again. 👎
Museum have good collection of history. 
There is a shop where you can get souvenirs and some snacks. 
Request to all Pakistanis. Please don’t stare when you see foreigners as they are not use to it.

Its built by my father's company later led by my mother. I know how the foundation of entire structure was laid. How the sweats of hard working labour turned the concept of monument into a reality. The construction engineering accompanied by an outclass architecture is itself a marvel. I hope the monument remains here till the end of world.

A good place to perceive the history and idealogy of Pakistan. Well designed and build but needed proper maintenance and cleaning. Must carry an umbrella and water if visiting during the day in Summer. Still it is better to visit in evening.

The Pakistan Monument is a national monument and heritage museum located on the western Shakarparian Hills in Islamabad, Pakistan. 
The monument, shaped as a blooming flower, is constructed to symbolize the unity of the Pakistani people. Its elevation makes the monument visible from across the Islamabad-Rawalpindi metropolitan area and is a popular tourist destination.

Very small museum, cool knowledgeable guides that seem to master a lot of the countrie's historic, traditional and mythological stories. In an hour you can see most part of it. There is a little shop outside of the museum where you can buy some artifacts that are also available elsewhere at lesser price.
I like this place but I would love it if it had enough traditional and local object. I think it doesn't represent enough the national heritage

I loved visiting this museum. I wish I could've taken pictures. Nevertheless, our tour guide, William Dayo, was very well versed in each of the exhibits. It was really nice to have someone with us who gave us in depth information on what we were viewing. It gave us a deeper understanding and appreciation for each of the artifacts.
It was nice. The museum has a lot to offer in cultural history and I was happy to see them opened on a Sunday.

This museum continues the tradition of equating Western African culture and history mainly with masks (sarcasm). It could almost be interchangeable with the museum's in Dakar and Bamako except they both have a second floor dedicated to textiles. 

Granted, the masks are interesting and high quality, but they are completely decontextualized with cryptic captions an little explanation tying anything together.

There is one table showing the evolution of money that was nice. 

It's one of the few times I wished there was a museum gift shop with some books. 

Weirdly they don't allow photography either, as if history should be hidden. 

Avoid the restaurant out back it is way overpriced and there are better maquis around.

If you are feeling adventurous give the Space Ball at National Planetarium a go: it is a human-sized gyroscopic device that spins volunteers around. However only try it if you have a cast-iron stomach. There is also an eerie UV-lit lift labelled the Galeri Pemandangan (Observation Gallery) that takes you up a minaret-like tower to the Viewing Gallery. You are provided with binoculars here and from this advantageous position you get the best views of the Lake Gardens and the rest of downtown.
Just amazing. Was thinking how could they make space explanation so simple. Good for a half a day with kids. Space pod is just a 4d theatre.
Just a simple planetarium with few exhibits related to space exploration....Hope they upgrade it like NASA in USA....
Not much to see. Almost no lighting, really hurt my eyes. Lots of exhibits not working and "under maintenance". Staff not very interested in being helpful. Disappointed.

The National Planetarium (Planetarium Negara KL) is dedicated to all things related to science and astronomy. It’s a fun and educational place for kids to learn about the planet and universe. Set on a hill to the east of Lake Gardens, it is topped by a blue dome easily visible from nearby roads. It may not be as high tech as the planetariums of New York or London standards, but it still merits a visit. The main entrance is evocative of a teleport chamber which leads into a series of halls containing two planetariums that have interactive exhibits (touch-screen interactive computers and hands-on experiments) plus a Space Theatre.
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.

Well known restaurant for decades. Beef noodles, clam noodles and chicken rice are the favourite here. Always packed. Avoid peak meal times. Not the best and ideal dining conditions but the taste make up for it.

Amazing superior clam soup noodle. The food here is just amazing and the wait is well worth it. Come here at 11am and get ready to wait for an hour for the food ... Food is amazing the clam is abundant. Service is non existent but that's kopitiam for you .... Want to order just wait there and order.

Beef noddle: Pricey & overrated. Only 5 small pieces of sliced beef with bland soup. Not recommended.

Lala meehoon: Soup is not bad but personally think that can be more flavorful. 

Place is very dirty and extremely hot. Not easy to get a seat. Usually sharing table with others.

The lala soup/ clam soup is really delicious. It has a strong alcoholic kick in it. The portion is very generous at 11 MYR. The queue is very long but you can order first and come back later. Expect 40 mins of wait during lunch hours even after 2pm on weekend !

Nice, authentic typical Chinese coffee shop which served chicken rice, beef noodles, seafood noodles and fried noodles.. lots of tables for customers to dine in, so no worries looking for a place to sit. Food wise I'll give an 8/10. Environment, one can imagine of an old Chinese coffee shop style and cleanliness.. 😃 ...(note :- very crowded during week end..)

The service is fantastic and very upper class. They really take care of you. 

Menu wise, they serve a great lunch choice.

I chose the smoked duck appetizer paired with a beef tenderloin main course and topped off with a blueberry tart dessert.

And the iced coffee is also divine. 

Price wise it is a little on the steep side but this is Le Meridien after all.
One of my favourite places for Italian. The prices are a little steep but it's great for a special occasion. I love the carpaccio and their pastas. The pizzas though were only okay.

Had my my girlfriend's birthday celebrations at this fantastic restaurant last weekend. Great environment. Had received great services with great tasty food. With Chef Domenico come personally wishing my girlfriend happy birthday. At the end had provide us extra slide of cake with candle as birthday cake. Really enjoy the dining experience that night. For sure will come back again in future.

Had a team lunch here, we pre-ordered the food and drinks a day in advance to prevent delays. Yet the kitchen still messed up the food and drinks orders and the chef refused to admit the mistake. The food here is also bland. For this price range, this kind of service and food quality are definitely disappointing

Excellent ambiance, excellent customer service and the most important of all amazing dishes. Had our wedding anniversary dinner there and the Chef Domenico was very kind and came to the table to congrats us. Totally worth every penny and I recommend this place to everyone.
I love this place you can get anything from here Coc weed women you name it
Very good area .
Wonderful place...
The happening place in Kuala Lumpur
Must to visit for every travellers

Good place to visit, I have managed to be there for sunset and it was stunning view. Stuff is nice and polite, they just want to take photos of you all the time and to sell you, but they do not boarder you too much, just say you don’t want to buy and that’s it. On The top, there is terrace with glass flor where you can go to take photos, they are taking photos, but they will also take photos with your camera.definite must do on a trip to KL. The views are spectacular and the sky box is worth the extra money. Book ahead of time online to get the best price and do check the weather. With heavy rains and thunder storms the sky deck will be closed and only the interior observation deck will be open. If you're not on the sky deck you're missing out. The observation deck limits the experience. Best time to go would be around sunset but there's the risk of rain. Tickets booked online are normally valid for a few days to a few months so you can always come back if the sky deck happens to be closed on a particular day. Restaurants inside are expensive so try to have a meal before you go. Unless you don't mind paying. It can become really busy and crowded so decide on the best time to go. Close to closing time it's a can be much less crowded.

View is good. There is different ticket for observation deck. But if you buy ticket for Sky deck...you can go to sky deck, sky box and observation deck too. 
 If you wish to go to sky deck and the sky box. You need to take a token number as you enter the sky deck. Then there is a long waiting for going to the sky box. And unfortunately  you will get only 4-5 min to spend there. And that time will be gone in taking pictures only. I hardly could enjoy or look around and I was told my time at Sky box was over. Observation deck is so so. You can hardly feel the height.  If you want to skip this place. You can. Depends on your definition of enjoyment.

If you plan on visiting the KL Tower I suggest you get tickets for the surrounding attractions as well to make it worth your time. The tower alone is a decent attraction, but you can get a much more enjoyable experience by visiting the other attractions as well. The staff at the tower are very helpful and ready to escort you right from the entrance of the tower (at the main gate you should wait for a shuttle to take you to the tower). If you want to go to the sky box, take note there are two. One to the left once you reach the top (this is the most popular one since it's the closest), and one a little further away to the right. You won't have a lot of time in the box as the staff there will hurry you along to allow others to go in, so plan your poses before hand.

Located in the heart of the city of Kuala Lampur this tower is a must visit for any tourist. There are restaurants here along with other activities. Real attraction is the sky deck here which gives the bird's eye view of this beautiful city. You can have both indoors and outdoors decks here. Pictures can't justify the beauty of this place. Must visit if you are around.

Fantastic Hi Tea in 360 revolving restaurant! Delicious huge buffet, lovely staff and amazing views of the city. We booked the early bird special online with TableApp for 10% discount and thought it was very good value for money. Enjoy a bottle of sparkling mead for a few extra ringgit - always good to try something new! The experience makes an excellent special treat and we would definitely go again :)
I love this place you can get anything from here Coc weed women you name it
Very good area .
Wonderful place...

Must to visit for every travellers

Good restaurant, nice atmosphere and impeccable service. Food is good, which has been mild to fit western tourist palate. Menus are reasonably priced, however the first one makes easily full.

We had been looking forward to trying this Malay restaurant for quite some time and we were not disappointed in the slightest! The flavours of all the dishes were so unique and distinctive! This meal was unlike any other fine dining experience we've had in recent memory. For sure we will look forward to coming back and trying some more dishes in the future!

Don't worry about the cost, your meal is definitely worth it! Great atmosphere in the evening. Ingredients of the highest quality, combined with restraint and balance. Got a pretty good portion size for a relatively modest price. This place comes highly recommended and I share the same sentiment.
The food is excellent and the staff the most friendly. I highly recommend to anyone willing to try Malay food. Would definitely go back !

Food quality and price were fabulous. Service could be improved though.

Why not 5 stars?
1. They served us the wrong wine and tried to make it our fault
2. We were sitting in the outside terrace so the smokers could enjoy a cigarette while drinking just to be sent infront of the restaurant. They could have said something before starting the dinner on that table

Excellent place for a variety of food Travellers will have a great time exploring the whole stretch of food, restaurants and bazaars. Also fantastic place for fruits I clouding dried ones. Juices are fresh everywhere. You can also just sit and have a drink enjoying the outdoor ambience. Great for photography. Advisable to choose restaurants with menus that have a set price. A must visit for Travellers. Love it!

Jalan Alor is one of the best place for foodies and dinner. Whether you are with family or with love of your life. This place is just right for anything. It is a street but covered with many food stalls. Main menus are seafood so if you are an avid seafood lover, this place would be a haven. 
 If you haven't been here, you definitely should. Do carry cash over here as many of them may not be credit card friendly.

Jalan Alor is a foodie paradise.  I come here every time I’m in Kuala Lumpur.  Not the cheapest prices in down but not overpriced either and it’s the best spot if you want to try a little bit of everything and not have to run all over the city.  

Some of my favorites: chicken wings, chili crab, grilled stingray (yup they sell it here), and there is a skewer place where you pick fresh seafood, beef, veggies, chicken skewers and they cook it for you.

Super busy closer to the evening, overpriced and very dirty. 
You have to be very lucky to get something worth to what you are paying for. Its very interesting to see, it is for sure. But be ready to be surrounded by beggars and street vendors who will be trying pull to towards their stand. 
We have been there about 4 times and only twice we were satisfied with the service. So it's the place where you might love it or hate it 50/50. 
You can just walk through and maybe try something you haven't, but if you want to eat there is plenty lovely restaurants which will cost you less and taste better.

Jalan Alor is a foodie paradise.  I come here every time I’m in Kuala Lumpur.  Not the cheapest prices in down but not overpriced either and it’s the best spot if you want to try a little bit of everything and not have to run all over the city.  Some of my favorites: chicken wings, chili crab, grilled stingray (yup they sell it here), and there is a skewer place where you pick fresh seafood, beef, veggies, chicken skewers and they cook it for you.
I love this place you can get anything from here Coc weed women you name it
Very good area .
Wonderful place...
The happening place in Kuala Lumpur
Must to visit for every travellers

Little bit hidden away. Staff at the front don’t yell and scream to get your attention like some other places in the area thankfully. 

The food was amazing. The service was fantastic and prompt. Found it by accident and went back a few times during the holiday. Good spot. If you’re in the area - stop in. Mixed grill all day.
Have been twice at this place while visiting KL. Such a delicious food! And really great service. Would come back again! Highly recommended.

GREAT!!! 
The food were absolutely delicious and suitable for all people. Not too spicy or salty. Many flavour in one dish. The food were freshly served. I recommend all the soup in the menu, especially the 1st and 4th. The atmosphere is cozy and quiet, looks like a high class restaurant.
Love the people there who were so kind offering to help us take a photo with the food. 5 stars for the service !!

It looks like a high class restaurant. The ambience and the environment of the restaurant is very good. The staff is helpful. We only ordered the Turkish coffee, and it tasted great. The price is reasonable. Highly recommended.

Years ago this place was one of the best Arabic restaurant in KL. Best Middle East food I ever had. I just had their Mendi Lamb this evening. It was the worst I had in my entire life. The lamb was dry and hard. The rice was just so-so. I think they have lost their previous chef. This is my last time going here.
I love this place you can get anything from here Coc weed women you name it
Very good area .
Wonderful place...
The happening place in Kuala Lumpur
Must to visit for every travellers

Excellent food and service. Very good prices.  Lots of happy hour offers.   Obviously doing something right as it was busy and bars to either side were empty on a Saturday evening.  Very good veggie samosas and butter chicken. Definitely coming again.

A place true to its name, having both bar essentials, in the form of drinks & hookah, as well kitchen, Offering a variety of snacks and main course. As its reins go back to Indian soil, the food served here does upkeep the Indian flavours.......One of the best of Changhat, bukit bintang

I often come here with my friends for drink and lil bit if dance. However, it was my first time trying the foods here. We shared the chicken something and raita (yoghurt thingy?) Also ordered long Island ice tea and Singapore sling. The food is better than I thought. The chicken is well flavoured and juicy. I really love the spices they used and how they cook the whole dishes. I mean, I can even eat green pepper that I hate just because of the flavour was hidden by the spices. Well besides that, the raita is really nice and goes well with the chicken. It was an excellent meal!

The ambiance upstairs is really cozy and more relaxing compared to downstair. The service given is as good as usual. I like the music played here and coincidentally there was live music on that day that makes it even better.
Best Killkenny in the street and good Happy Hour prices. Great staff and good food too
Tasty indian food and decent service. Good Street for nightlife lovers.
I love this place you can get anything from here Coc weed women you name it
Very good area .
Wonderful place...
The happening place in Kuala Lumpur
Must to visit for every travellers

Love the hot chocolate. So thick. The breakfast dish was so-so. Fresh cherry tomatoes but baked beans and mushrooms were bland. We also had the Belgium waffles with ice cream. It was crispy, dense and sweet.

I’ve been to Pavilion hundreds of times but never ate at any of the cafes. This is a good place to people watch, with the thick hot chocolate.
Food was mediocre.. had a croque madam and found the bread extremely sweet. Nice place to relax and people watch.. coffee was fine and staff very helpful indeed...

reviews.author_name: Feel Love And Joy With Me
reviews.text: I ordered the summer fruit bowl.  It looked nothing like the picture and cost 25.50 after tax.  Avoid that menu item unless you want to waste money.

Been scrolling through places for breakfast near the Pavilion and I’ve found out this cafe. Overall, the food was good. The presentation was ordinary and not fancy. But, you could not imagine that these food taste real good.
Good place to take a break during your shopping in pavilion. Not expencive.
I love this place you can get anything from here Coc weed women you name it
Very good area .

Must to visit for every travellers

Very good area .
Wonderful place...
The happening place in Kuala Lumpur
Must to visit for every travellers

My partner and me went there on a Saturday night for a special celebration. It's being advertised as having 8 rooms but none of them are connected to each other. Each room require a new entry fee (beware). We chose the main room. It was surprisingly small though its the biggest in size among the 8 rooms. The place is pretty much dead before 1am. It was never packed after 1pm. If you do not want to party with people around the age of 20, then this is not your club to go. As for the music, it was terrific compared to other clubs I been to around the world. In a nutshell, there was no flow to the music. Dance floor was small and stuffy hot. Overall, the experience was very poor. Very curious to know whether or not did Zouk paid to get into top 100 clubs? For future go-ers, thinking 10 times before deciding to go or not.

It is a Worst club in KL. Do not recommend going.  Rude service, just because they think they are the best in town.  

Trying to rip tourist off.  Stay away. There are far more better clubs that has a better vibe and friendly service.  Ladies night, was a 3 to 1 guy/girl.  Figure that out.

And you have to pay for parking as well.

I DON’t recommend it.

Was here for ladies night on a Wednesday. Was a little disappointed that only Velvet was opened that evening (Thursdays they have 2 rooms, and Fridays/Saturdays all rooms). It was also really empty until midnight, like, 5 guests in the entire club before that kind of empty. Because of work the next morning, we had to leave early, but from the looks of it, wasn't supposed to expect much in any case. Perhaps more a weekend spot, unlike the Zouk in Singapore where it's always bustling. Also - this place allows cigarettes, so it can be quite an annoying experience for some.
Best For chilling on weekends specially saturday night 😉 Entry ticket is just 50RM in which you can buy a drink too. Beer or Soft drink of your choice.
Awesome place and comfortable. It's getting crowded after 12. So, dont try it before.

One of the best Italian restaurants in Dublin,  in my opinion, for many years. Recently, the restaurant has been refurbished and is now even cosier and more comfortable than it used to be. Also, the menu is very keenly priced and the early-bird menu is especially good value with the Bellini thrown in at no extra charge. The Italian staff are all totally professional, efficient, friendly and welcoming.

The staff was nice and friendly but the dish I had wasn't that great. The presentation was very good but taste and texture could have been better.

Looking at the other reviews, everyone seems to like so maybe it was just me. I will try something different next time.

For everyone else, go there and make up you own mind.

Visited this restaurant by chance on a quiet weeknight. Service was superb as was the food. Mushroom ravioli was the best we’ve ever had compared to many other similar restaurants (our favourite dish). Reasonable prices for the area with many specials. We will definitely be back!

Excellent food and excellent service, went here for a family get together and went for the set menu. Everyone raved about the starters and main courses. Excellent wine too. Slightly disappointed I didn't get the pizza as it looked amazing going to other tables. I'll definitely be back for the pizza, I might be changing my review to five stars. Keep up the excellent work folks! Viva Italia!

Best Italian restaurant in Dublin. 
Definitely our favourite place to have meals whether it's just a quick lunch or romantic dinner!!!
Highly recommended! 10/10

Extremely poor. Very dated and tired restaurant. Bread came out and was stale.. hard as a rock. Food was greasy and just overall not appealing. Service was equally poor.. had to ask five people for the check, had multiple people ask for our order.. the restaurant wasn’t busy and somehow they managed to make things extremely complicated. Very very disappointed with the horrible food and poor service. Won’t be back

Paradiso is our family's go to place. We like their Sunday brunch and we have enjoyed their musical acts over many years. Their pizza is wood fired and delicious. Good consistent service and the food quality is very good.
The staff was considerate. Wide choice of menu items. Food was so fresh and came out fast! Full of flavor.
Had our school's annual staff appreciation dinner here. Great food and great service! Will return...
Nice place. Kid friendly space with the adjoining adult room. Good reliable place for Italian comfort food.

This recent trip is our family’s second stay at Shangrila Bangkok. The first was awesome, which brought us back for our second. This stay has been comfortable and enjoying for my children, as well as my parents. Friendly and helpful staff at the lobby on our arrival. My 6 year old girl vomited after our taxi ride from the airport. A few female young staff were extremely helpful, quickly handing us towels and helped consoling my girl, and later offered her a drink. These staff were so fast and so helpful! We felt very warm at heart!!! Our balcony rooms were wonderful. And I must highly recommend the breakfast at next2. Superb variety, great food and very attentive service! We will definitely come back!

Thank you for the colleague who did the check in. Even our room booking was under staff rate, she was patient to introduce and solve our problem which was treating us as guest. Very helpful and kind.
Also, the Chi spa was excellent. I went to Thailand and tried different spa for many times. The therapist-Honey in Chi spa was even the best. Her warm smile made me felt welcomed at the beginning and the massage made me felt worth to pay. Thank you for the relaxing experience she gave to me.

This place has been around for a while now, and it's well-known among the locals - for good reason! It's a superb hotel, and the staff members are excellent. Our company reserved the conference hall for a half day and evening for a full company meeting, and everything went really well. The Chinese dinner they served was excellent! (Peking duck - very, very good.)

Really, there are no complaints about this place. It's an added bonus that the hotel is sitting right next to the Chaophraya River, and you can get great views from the hotel bar or even the pool deck.

Would be a great getaway place.

I would have loved to give it a 5 star because of its location and ambience but reducing a star for complexity of navigating between meeting rooms and Building wings. You can't help being lost. Having said that, staff are very helpful and show you the way and you reach your destination walking really long!

The staff were kind, and the food in the lounge was delicious.
Only thing to be improved is cleanliness of the table in the lounge. I could see the traces of the cups left in many places and a little bit sticky when I am touching on surface of the table. It seems they have not wiped the table clean after the customer left.

And the communication skill/ background information about hotel facility should be more improved. We asked if we could borrow ping-pong racket /ball to play table tennis near swimming pool (Depending on each hotel policy, we used to borrow the racket and ball before) however, the staff in Krungthep lobby told us that we have to purchase the racket and ball in Robinson shopping mall whereas we found that racket and ball were equipped beside on the table while taking a walk later.
